alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chouteau and northeastern Cascade Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 630 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Great Falls, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, hail up to half inch, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Belt, Black Eagle, Highwood, Ulm, Malmstrom Afb, Sand Coulee, Tracy, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Western and Central Chouteau County
